section.name: Quickstart
section.span: Check it out yourself and install the quickstart demo site.
section.p: The HST2 Getting Started packages contain all the core components, and have been pre-configured with a number of modules and settings, to give you a quick overview of the HST2.

subsection.name: Download
subsection.p: Two WAR packages are available for download. You can deploy them in either Tomcat or Jetty or any other servlet container that you prefer. Note: Hippo HST2 has not been released. The following downloads are snapshots of the current build.

li.span: For CMS the quickstart package is called quickstart and this one gettingstarted, while `hst' is not part of the package name. I think all quickstart packages should have `quickstart' in their name and they also all should contain the project (product) name in their name. Or maybe there is some other consistent and clear naming scheme.

subsection.name: Deploying in Tomcat 6.0
subsection.p: Below, the Tomcat folder is called $TOMCATDIR. It may be something like /usr/local/share/apache-tomcat-6.0.18, depending of course where you have or will put Tomcat and which version of Tomcat you have.

tr.td: Download Hippo CMS quickstart demo package WAR for HST2 to the folder $TOMCATDIR/webapps/ with the package file renamed to cms.war. This package contains in addition to the plain Hippo CMS and repository a plugin adding some hst structural elements to the repository and a plugin adding some sample content to the repository.
Download Hippo HST2 quickstart demo package WAR to the folder $TOMCATDIR/webapps/ with the package file renamed to site.war.
Startup Tomcat normally. Tomcat will automatically deploy the new war files and create equally named folders for them, in this case 'cms' and 'site'. Need help?
The sample site can be found at http://localhost:8085/preview/index via your browser. First look at how the sample site looks like and think of something you might want to change.
For configuring the sample site, open the site http://localhost:8080/cms/console/ in your browser.

You can read the repository with any JCR client. Hippo supplies a readonly JCR client at http://localhost:8080/cms/repository.
JCR clients allow a subset of XPATH and SQL to be used to query a repository. For example http://localhost:8080/cms/repository?xpath=/jcr:root/content//* in your browser. Warning: The XPATH query //* will never finish on the Hippo repository, due to recursive references.
JSR specification download page
JSR-000170 specification
For the CMS open the site http://localhost:8080/cms in your browser.
